title: Cafe Manager
description:
Compilation Coffee Roasters is seeking a store manager for our 343 Gold Street location in Downtown Brooklyn.

Please include a cover letter with your resume. We want to know more about you as a person! What are your passions? What do you love about coffee and customer service? What can you do to make Compilation Coffee Roasters the best cafe in NYC? We want to know about YOU - not merely where you have worked.

Position Summary:

The manager will oversee a team of 3-5 baristas, maintaining the highest level of customer service and coffee knowledge. You will be responsible for training and nurturing team members, quality control, maintaining sales goals, inventory, and cleanliness of the cafe. This will truly be your ship to steer and you will work directly with the the founders to ensure the best experience for customers and employees alike. We know you are the one who is in the shop daily; we always welcome and NEED your constant feedback.

Responsibilities will include, but are not limited to:

● Ensure a safe and welcoming work environment, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

● Ensure that shop behavior is in accordance with the missions of the company and our partnered charities.

● Tracking Inventory and ordering accordingly

● Confirming deliveries and reconciling mistakes

● Dialing in coffee

● Light maintenance of all equipment

● 5 floor shifts weekly

● Cover shifts if needed

● Train new staff on equipment and coffees

● Ensure staff has studied and knows everything about our coffee offerings. They should be able to explain or talk about any of our coffees and that would start with you.

● Oversea cleanliness and organization of the cafe.

● Open and willing ability to embrace change.

**Qualifications:**

● 3 + years management experience in specialty coffee required.

● Experience managing a profitable cafe.

● Experience reviewing financial reports (P&L) and meeting and maintaining budgets and sales goals.

● Ability to stay calm and professional no matter what the situation.

● Strong leadership skills, focused on mutual respect and the ability to help them grow. The goal is to empower, not to micromanage.

● Food Handlers Certificate.

● Experience recruiting, hiring and training new staff.

● Ability to execute company's goals and objectives according to handbook guidelines.

● Must be able to exercise independent judgment and decision-making skills.

● Experience in a fast-paced environment, with the ability to multi-task and meet numerous simultaneous deadlines.

● Able to work full time (30 - 40 hours per week) including variable hours including early morning, evenings, weekend and/or holidays.

● Experience with POS touch screen (Square Mobile Terminal), Odeko Ordering Platform, Blue Cart, Microsoft Office, Google Suite and other computer skills.

We provide equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation,gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Job Type: Full-time  
Compensation: Competitive Hourly + Tips + Substantial Bonus structure

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 30 – 40 per week

title: Undergraduate Student Content Creator — Office of University Relations
description:
Job Description
Are you a current Stevens undergraduate student passionate about social media and content creation? The Office of University Relations is seeking a part-time Student Content Creator. In this role, you’ll work closely with our communications specialist to elevate Stevens’ presence on Instagram and TikTok. From collaborating and producing captivating videos to creating engaging posts and analyzing social media trends, you’ll provide support as we promote the Stevens brand and enhance our digital footprint.  

Specific Responsibilities:* Draft and contribute to the development of original and compelling social media content tailored for Stevens’ Instagram and TikTok platforms.
* Assist in producing dynamic videos that highlight campus life, events and student achievements.
* Stay informed about social media trends and propose integration into content strategies.
* Utilize analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Sprout Social) to track and analyze post-performance metrics.
* Collaborate with the communications specialist and broader University Relations team to brainstorm and research new content ideas aligned with our short- and long-term social media goals.
  

Qualifications:* Currently enrolled as an undergraduate student at Stevens Institute of Technology.
* Detail-oriented with strong interpersonal skills.
* Proficient in posting content on Instagram and TikTok.
* Availability during the academic year, including regular business hours, some nights, and weekends.
  

Hours:  

This position offers 10 hours per week starting in Fall 2024, with the potential for continuation through the Spring 2025.  

General Submission Guidelines:  

Please submit an online application to be considered a candidate for any job at Stevens. Please attach a cover letter and resume with each application.  

Still Have Questions?
If you have any questions regarding your application, please contact Jobs@Stevens.edu.

title: General Manager
description:
**Job Description Summary**


The General Manager (GM) is the onsite leader of the hotel and represents the company with all guests, clients, associates, and owners. The General Manager is responsible for consistently delivering results that contribute to the mission and overall success of the hotel by accomplishing performance objectives focused on driving revenue, controlling costs, providing guest and associate satisfaction, and delivering product and service quality. To accomplish this the GM will work directly with Sonesta’s marketing, revenue management, and sales team and the shared accounting, facilities, human resources, information technology and procurement services that support the hotels.**Job Description**

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**:

* Deliver on the promise of Sonesta Service in all interactions with guests and clients. Manage according to the Sonesta G.U.E.S.T. standards and instill a passion for customer service in all associates of the hotel. Create processes and procedures to ensure the hotel is properly supplied with all guest amenities, all food and beverage outlets are meeting guest expectations, and the hotel is properly maintained and clean.
* Manage the direct sales activities of the hotel in partnership with the hotel’s Regional Sales Director (RSD) and Global Sales Office (GSO) to uncover the appropriate demand located in the hotel’s trade area. Directly supervise the hotel’s Director of Sales and partner with the above sales support team to create and execute the hotel’s sales and marketing plan to secure the fair market share of business for the hotel.
* Manage the overall seasonal demand strategy in partnership with the hotel’s Regional Revenue Manager (RRM) with regard to room type and length of stay pricing. Work with the hotel’s property management system (Opera) and reservation system (Synxis) to maximize revenue through occupancy and rate adjustments based on market conditions.
* Regularly sell hotel rooms through direct client contact.
* Establish and implement appropriate service recovery guidelines in order to ensure complete guest satisfaction. Respond to guest complaints or concerns in a prompt and professional manner.
* Manage the Sonesta ES Suites brand positioning through the proper use of all marketing programs. This would include, but is not limited to the creation of everyday surprises, the implementation and management of the company’s guest recognition program (Travel Pass) and the proper use of all logo and graphics standards.
* Manage the front office, housekeeping, and food and beverage operation of the hotel through the direct supervision of the Operations Manager.
* Manage the appearance, condition, and preventive maintenance of the physical plant through the direct supervision of the Maintenance Manager.
* Attend Evening Social and Breakfast events as a representative of the management team of the hotel and to prospect for additional sales leads.
* Lead the development, implementation and monitoring of capital and operational budgets for the hotel which support the overall objectives of the company. Work with the Finance Department on the identification of variances and communication to ownership on the hotel’s financial condition.
* In partnership with the hotel’s assigned General Ledger Accountant and in accordance with company rules and policies, ensure the proper process is in place to manage and report the inflow of money in and out of the hotel.
* In partnership with the Manager, National Engineering and Facilities Operations and in accordance with company rules and policies, ensure the proper process is in place to manage and report on the condition of the physical building(s), grounds, and parking surfaces. This includes the creation and management of the hotel’s annual capital and operations expense budget to improve and maintain the facility for guests and ownership.
* In partnership with the hotel’s assigned Human Resources representatives and in accordance with company rules and policies, ensure the proper process is in place to manage and report on the human resources and benefits programs within the hotel. This includes the recruiting, onboarding, training, ongoing performance management, and offboarding of all associates of the hotel.
* In partnership with the assigned Information Technology representatives and in accordance with company rules and policies, ensure the proper process is in place to manage and report on the proper use, maintenance and location of all information technology hardware and software provided to the hotel. This includes the proper use of all systems in order to service all guests and provide a return on investment to owners.
* In partnership with the assigned Procurement representatives and in accordance with company rules and policies, ensure the proper process is in place to manage and report on the purchasing of all supplies needed to manage the hotel. This includes the proper use of any platforms and/or programs to leverage purchasing power and the analysis of hotel spending to identify efficiencies.
* Enforce hotel standards, policies, and procedures are in place within the hotel departments.
* Act as “Manager on duty” as required.
* Ensure compliance with federal, state and local laws regarding health, safety, and alcohol services.
* Perform other duties as assigned.

**QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS**:

* Bachelor’s degree in Hotel Administration, Business Administration or related field preferred.
* Three years as a General Manager, Operations Manager, and/or Director of Sales in extended stay hotels preferred.
* Ability to speak, read, and write fluent English; other languages beneficial.
* Professional verbal and written communication skills.
* Mathematical skills, including basic math, budgeting, profit/loss concepts, percentages, and variances.
* Problem solving, reasoning, motivating, organizational and training abilities.
* Ability to prioritize and organize work assignments.
* Experience with Microsoft Office and Opera systems preferred.
* Ability to travel including some overnight travel is required.
* Valid driver’s license required.
* Frequently standing up, bending, climbing, kneeling, and moving about the facility.
* Will be exposed to commercial cleaning chemicals
* Carrying, lifting or pulling items weighing up to 50 pounds.
* Frequently handling objects and equipment.
* Will be required to work mornings, evening, weekends, and holidays.

**Additional Job** **Information/Anticipated**

**Pay Range**


Pay range $100,000 - $105,000. Base pay offered may vary depending on various factors including but not limited to job related knowledge, skills and job specific experience/overall experience.

**Benefits**


Sonesta recognizes that benefits play a vital role in helping ensure the health and financial security of employees and their families. We offer a variety of benefits to our employees including:

* Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance
* Health Savings Account with Company Match
* 401(k) Retirement Plan with Company Match
* Paid Vacation and Sick Days
* Sonesta Hotel Discounts
* Educational Assistance
* Paid Parental Leave
* Company Paid Life Insurance
* Company Paid Short Term and Long Term Disability Insurance
* Various Employee Perks and Discounts
* Hospital Indemnity
* Critical Illness Insurance
* Accident Insurance

**Upon submitting your application, please ensure you complete a full application in addition to attaching a resume. Incomplete applications received will not be considered.**

title: Field Producer, Fox Business Network
description:
OVERVIEW OF THE COMPANY
Fox Business Network
FOX Business Network (FBN) is a financial news channel delivering real-time information across all platforms that impact both Main Street and Wall Street. Headquartered in New York — the business capital of the world — FBN launched in October 2007 and currently ranks among the top business channels on television. The network is available in nearly 80 million homes in all markets across the United States. Owned by FOX Corporation, FBN is a unit of FOX News Media and has bureaus in Chicago, Los Angeles, and Washington, D.C.
JOB DESCRIPTION
FOX Business is looking for a seasoned Field Producer to join our team in the NY Bureau. The ideal candidate is a business news junkie who has excellent newsgathering skills and a network of strong contacts. The Field Producer will use their editorial skills to follow leads, break news, and pitch original stories. You are a proactive, passionate, and self-motivated individual who can collaborate with our producers and reporters to advance the network’s coverage on all platforms.
A SNAPSHOT OF YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES* Produce reporter live shots and packages in the NY Bureau and on-location
* Travel domestically and internationally to cover breaking news, often at the last minute for extended periods
* Pitch and develop original story ideas
* Assist reporters in gathering elements for television and online coverage
* Write articles to be published on FOXBusiness.com
* Handle all newsgathering logistics: book travel, book field crews
* Coordinate all aspects of production: book and conduct interviews, write scripts, order graphics, and produce live shots


WHAT YOU WILL NEED* A Bachelor's degree in journalism or a related field of study preferred, or equivalent experience
* 3+ years experience as a reporter, writer, producer, and/or editor at a news organization
* Extensive field production experience
* Strong research and writing skills
* Demonstrated communication skills to work with correspondents and photographers in the field
* Strong local contacts
* A passion for business and current events
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and prioritize daily, especially in a breaking news situation
* Production experience in breaking news and feature reporting
* Willingness to travel and work long hours, including weekends with short notice


#LI-KC1*We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories consistent with applicable law.**At FOX, we foster a culture and environment where everyone feels welcome and can thrive. We are deeply committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion, including attracting, retaining, and promoting diverse talent across our company. We live in a diverse world, with different ideas and different perspectives that come together to spark new ideas and make great things happen. That means reflecting the diversity of the world around us is critical to our company’s success. We ensure that our viewers, communities and employees feel heard, represented, and celebrated both on screen and off.*  


Pursuant to state and local pay disclosure requirements, the pay range for this role, with final offer amount dependent on education, skills, experience, and location is: $84,500.00-105,000.00 annually for New York City and Westchester County, NY. This role is also eligible for various benefits, including medical/dental/vision, insurance, a 401(k) plan, paid time off, and other benefits in accordance with applicable plan documents. Benefits for Union represented employees will be in accordance with the applicable collective bargaining agreement.
View more detail about FOX Benefits.

title: Customization Specialist
description:
**Company Description**  

Lingraphica is a mission-driven organization who provides speech-generating devices to help improve communication, speech, and quality of life for people with communication impairments. We look for candidates who enjoy working in a fast-paced, goal-oriented environment, and who share our commitment to helping individuals on their communccation journey.

 **Job Description** **Purpose**: The Customization Specialist is responsible for providing outstanding customer experience by personalizing Speech Generating Devices (SGDs) in a timely and accurate manner. This position serves as the main point of contact for our customers and internal employees when a device needs to be customized before, during, and after a device trial.

**Essential Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Personalizes speech generating devices with user provided information and preferences
* Provides multi-channel outreach to patients, care partners, and Speech Language Pathologists
* Prioritizes responsibilities and proactively follows up on tasks
* Completes updates to customizations upon request
* Submits shipping requests to fulfillment team and coordinates with fulfillment team to address shipping issues
* Uses internal CRM HubSpot to complete tasks
* Follows HIPAA guidelines regarding Protected Health Information
* Communicates with all internal teams and departments with a collaborative mindset
* Proactively considers processes with a goal of ongoing process improvement to make processes more efficient and better serve our customers
* Meets or exceeds Operations team goals and metrics; uses reports and audits to track productivity
* Performs other duties as needed and engages in projects and workgroups

  

**Qualifications** **Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**

* Strong time management skills
* Strong sense of urgency
* Ability to quickly adapt to shifting departmental and company needs
* Ability to multi-task and handle multiple projects at once
* Excellent communication skills
* Comfort communicating with individuals with speech disabilities
* Customer Service oriented with friendly, courteous, and professional demeanor
* Propensity to pick up technology
* Bilingual – English/Spanish, preferred

**Education & Experience**

* High school diploma or GED
* 1-year office or administrative experience, preferably supporting an Operations team
* 1 year of customer or technical support experience, preferred
* Experience using HubSpot or other CRM, preferred

  

**Additional Information** **Work Environment & Physical Demands**


Flexible (EST): Monday – Friday: 8 am - 4 pm, 9 am – 5 pm, or 10 am – 6 pm


Incumbent may work from home and is expected to maintain a safe, productive work environment with secure, high speed internet access.

**Travel**


Travel to Lingraphica’s home office in NJ and to cities within the continental United States for company related meetings required 2 times per year.

**Accommodations**


To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty and physical demand satisfactorily. The requirements listed above are representative of the knowledge, skills, and/or abilities and physical demands required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**To learn more about Lingraphica, visit:** **www.lingraphica.com****!**

title: Medical Assistant/Patient Care Representative
description:
**About Skin Secrets Dermatology:**  
Skin Secrets Dermatology offers comprehensive dermatologic care including medical, surgical and cosmetic dermatology. We are a new practice located in Park Ridge, NJ eager to provide quality care to our community.

Providing exceptional patient care is our number one priority. We strive to be one of the best places to work in the Bergen County area. We are looking for the best and brightest to join our team and continue our excellence in dermatologic care.

**Job Description**:  
This is a job-sharing position that include the medical assistant and patient care representative roles. The medical assistant role will assist our board-certified providers during skin exams, general dermatology office visits, and office procedures including biopsies and injections. The patient care representative role is responsible for maintaining a friendly, warm, and inviting environment at the Front Desk/Patient Check-In area and/or the Patient Check-Out area. It is important that Patient Care Representatives are polite, attentive, and organized. Additionally, they should be able to effectively communicate with patients and assist them in any way possible.

**Job Responsibilities for Medical Assistant Role:**

* Take patient histories, performing vital signs and record information in EMR system.
* Prepare patients for outpatient procedures and routine skin exams.
* Maintain appropriate pathology log and communicate results to patients.
* Clean and maintain examination and treatment rooms daily.
* Manage equipment and supply inventory.
* Serve as a liaison between physicians and patients.
* Copy and mail requests for medical records ensuring HIPAA compliance.

**Job Responsibilities for Patient Care Representative Role:** 

* Answer multi line phone and either direct the caller to the appropriate party or handle the caller’s needs.
* Greet patients upon arrival, sign them in and obtain insurance information and any other necessary data.
* Provide patients with new patient forms as well as copies of our office policies and legally required documents.
* Scan paperwork into patient’s file.
* Schedule appointments for new and recurring patients.
* Call and remind patients of upcoming appointments.
* Provide patients with support and guidance as needed.
* Collect monies, process end of day reports.
* Ability to handle a fast-paced environment and prioritize tasks based on importance.
* Excellent communication and problem-solving skills.
* Order office supplies.
* Verifies insurance coverage and obtains insurance authorizations/referrals/pre-certification as required for all new/established patients.
* Verifies insurance information every 90 days on all established patients and follows up on referrals/authorizations to assure they are current and active.
* Pulls daily a list of add on appointments. Verifies insurance if over 90 days and requests referral/authorization when needed.
* Maintains appropriate knowledge of insurance requirements to include knowledge of which carriers require referrals and/or authorizations and pre-certifications.
* Has sufficient knowledge of correlation between procedures and payable diagnosis.
* Communicates with patients to advise if written referral is required prior to appointment/procedure. Provides information regarding Authorizations Process, schedules and procedures to assure efficient capture of revenue for services rendered.
* Maintains ongoing communication with Practice Administrator and the RCS responsible for other functions of the Revenue Cycle.

**Qualifications:**

* Candidates must possess previous hands-on experience in a medical assistant position.
* Current CPR/BLS certification
* The ideal candidate should be a self-starter, reliable, detail oriented, possess a strong capability for multi-tasking in a fast-paced environment.
* Professional, friendly demeanor
* Works well in team environment
* Dermatology experience a plus
* EMR documentation
* Customer service experience required.
* Pay range: $17-21/hr depending on experience
* Paid vacation and holidays

Other:

* Employee discounts on products and services

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $17.00 - $21.00 per hour

title: GAP Claims Adjuster
description:

title: DSP (Direct Support Professional)
description:
PennReach is a non-profit who provides full service/in home care to individuals with special needs. We support individuals to live in apartments of their own in various affordable housing developments, as well as in our group homes in the state of New Jersey. Our goal is to not only provide individuals with housing, but to maintain the supports to give our residents the life they deserve. We are looking to hire DSP's (Direct Support Professionals) for our Metuchen location.

REQUIREMENTS:

* High school diploma or equivalent
* Driver’s license valid in the State of NJ with good driving record
* Shall be at least 18 years of age or older.
* Employee must cooperate with the licensee and Department staff in any inspection or investigation.

REQUIRED SKILL LEVEL:

* The ability to exercise good judgment and use common sense.
* The ability to remain calm in crisis situations.
* The ability to interact with a wide range of people.

RESPONSIBILITIES INCLUDE:

* Works a flexible 40 hour week. May be assigned to one or varied programs.
* Assists individuals, as necessary in daily living skills.
* Completes training with individuals toward IHP goals.
* Attends conferences, seminars and training relevant to the position.
* Administers medication and completes documentation of same.
* Accompanies individuals to and from appointments and activities.
* Builds a support network between the individuals and community members.
* Accurately completes all in-house documentation
* Participates in Circle(s) of Support for personal futures planning.
* Completes all duties as delegated by the Residential Manager/Assistant Residential Manager.
* Must successfully complete and demonstrate proficiency in all areas of required training.
* Perform any and all duties requested of supervisor.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: Up to $18.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)

* Weekends as needed

title: Personal Injury Defense Attorney
description:
Personal Injury Defense Attorney


Wilson Elser's Stamford office is currently seeking a Personal Injury Defense Attorney.


This is an excellent opportunity for attorneys who are looking to expand their skillset and experience at the nation’s preeminent defense litigation firm.


The Firm  

Wilson Elser is a full-service and leading defense litigation law firm that faithfully serves our clients with more than 1100 attorneys, across 44 offices across the United States. Founded in 1978, we rank among the top 200 law firms identified by The American Lawyer and 43rd in The National Law Journal's survey of the nation's largest law firm.


The Position


Qualifications


* JD from an accredited law school
* Must be admitted to practice in the state of Connecticut
* 3+ years’ experience with civil defense litigation
* Personal injury defense experience preferred
* Experience in transportation, trucking, energy, and maritime industries a plus
* Must have experience with motion practice and depositions
* Trial and trial preparation experience is a plus
* Superior written and oral communication skills


Responsibilities


* Independently manage a litigation caseload, working cases from beginning to end
* Work closely with other attorneys and Partners on legal projects
* Regularly handle court appearances and depositions
* Communicate with clients and provide status reports


Why Should You Apply?


* Excellent Benefits including a 401k match
* Professional development programs including in-house CLE and National Attorney Training

* Excellent growth and advancement opportunities

title: Intake Nurse Manager- Full-Time- Brooklyn, NY
description:
Our client, A Leading Health Care Agency, is seeking a highly motivated and experienced Intake Nurse Manager to join their team. The Intake RN Manager will be responsible for supervising, instructing, and guiding intake coordinators and auxiliary personnel in the referral intake process. This role involves designing and implementing efficient work processes to ensure seamless communication between departments, referral sources, and physicians. Play a key role in ensuring efficient referral processes that enhance patient care and satisfaction.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **Supervision & Leadership:** Supervise, instruct, and guide intake coordinators and auxiliary personnel to ensure high-quality referral intake and follow-through.
* **Process Design & Implementation:** Develop and implement efficient work processes to facilitate sound communication between departments, referral sources, and physicians.
* **Team Management:** Provide ongoing support and guidance to the intake team, fostering a collaborative and efficient work environment.
* **Performance Monitoring:** Monitor and evaluate the performance of intake staff, ensuring compliance with organizational standards and implementing improvements as needed.
* **Communication Facilitation:** Ensure effective and timely communication between all stakeholders involved in the referral process.

**Qualifications:**

* **Experience:**

Minimum of 2 years of experience in a Certified Home Health Agency (CHHA) intake department.

At least 1 year of supervisory experience in a related field.

* **Technical Skills:**

Proficiency with Allscripts or similar electronic health record (EHR) systems.

* **Additional Skills:**

Strong leadership and communication skills.

Ability to design and implement efficient work processes.

Excellent organizational and multitasking abilities.

Job Type: Full-time

title: Part-time Registered Nurse
description:
The Center’s mission is to help children and adults with differing abilities achieve their dreams. We do this by offering programs that support people with disabilities to live, work, learn and enjoy recreational opportunities in the community of their choice.

Our vision is to support people through teams that are dedicated to the achievement of excellence and innovation, embraced within a community based upon respect, kindness and open communication.

Center for Developmental Disabilities Values:

* Everyone is treated with dignity and respect.
* People are supported to reach their unique and maximum potential.
* Individual choices are encouraged and incorporated into everyday life.

Join a caring and supportive group of nurses in the field of intellectual and developmental disabilities whose focus is on providing the highest quality nursing care by advocating, educating, and promoting optimal health.

Our work environment includes:

* Group home settings.
* Flexible working hours.
* Supportive nursing team.

At the Center, we embrace diverse voices and value the seen and unseen qualities that make each person unique. We are committed to the advocacy for people with disabilities through the creation of a community based upon full inclusion and equity. Our commitment to DEI learning facilitates opportunities and growth for our employees so that the people we support may thrive.

**Some Job Responsibilities:**

* Coordinationof medical services.
* Assess patient's health status and develop individualized plans of nursing services.
* Monitor and document patient's condition and response to medications and treatments.
* Initial certification/annual recertification of Approved Medication Assistive Personnel.
* Educate staff, individuals and their families about health maintenance and prevention.
* Maintain accurate medical records.

The ideal candidate will have passion for helping others, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work independently as well as in a team setting.

**Job Qualifications:**

* Valid NYS RN license
* Experience working with individuals with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities preferred
* Valid NYS Driver’s License.
* Must be able to sit, stand, lift 50 lbs.

**Social Media:**

Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/TheCenterforDevelopmentalDisabilites/

Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/thecenterfordd/?hl=en

**No COVID Vaccine Required.**

**New Graduates Welcome!**

**We provide a robust benefit package and a $5,000 Sign-On Bonus.**

**Stipend available if you would want to work with a larger caseload.**

**An employee's salary is based on commensurate experience and other qualifications. This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee. title: Paralegal
description:
Paralegal


Wilson Elser's New York City office currently seeks a Paralegal


This position entails being a part of a team oriented approach that consists of attorneys and paralegals in the coordinated evaluation and resolution of each matter addressed within a Legal Project Management approach.


This is an excellent opportunity for a recent college graduate or individual who wishes to learn paralegal skills through working with experienced litigation attorneys. It is a unique opportunity to gain hands-on experience for developing paralegal skills in a very active team environment.


The Firm  

Wilson Elser is a full-service and leading defense litigation law firm that faithfully serves our clients with more than 1100 attorneys, across 44 offices across the United States. Founded in 1978, we rank among the top 200 law firms identified by The American Lawyer and 43rd in The National Law Journal's survey of the nation's largest law firm.


The Position


Qualifications


* Bachelor’s degree and paralegal certificate are preferred
* 2-5 years’ experience a plus.
* Experience with communicating with outside vendors, maintaining records, organizing and maintaining a calendar, comfortable in team-work based environment. Summarizing transcripts, discovery and trial preparation plus.
* Clear and effective communication skills both orally and written
* Strong computer skills with proficient in MS Office Suite and document management systems
* Attention to detail and organizational skills are critical
* Must be able to work independently and be proactive
* Must be able to multitask and successfully manage a variety of demands daily


Responsibilities


* Obtain authorizations for medical records as well as medical records themselves
* Draft discovery demands and responses
* Prepare records, review and prepare exhibits, summarize medical records and deposition transcripts, and trial preparation
* Review, analyze and organize document productions by opposing parties and co-defendants
* Review file for outstanding discovery in preparation for court appearances, pleadings, depositions and trial preparation
* Determine, prepare and organize material needed for expert witness review
* Assemble chronologies of key documents
* Manage documents and organize case files


Why Should You Apply?


* Excellent Benefits including a 401k match
* Generous PTO plan
* Excellent growth and advancement opportunities
* Corporate Discount Plans


A variety of factors are considered in making compensation decisions, including but not limited to experience, education, licensure and/or certifications, geographic location, market demands, other business and organizational needs, and other factors permitted by law. The expected salary range for this position is $50,000 to $70,000 Final salary wages offered may be outside of this range based on other reasons and individual circumstances. This position is considered full-time and therefore qualifies for benefits including 401(k) retirement savings plan, medical, dental, vision, disability, and life insurance. Details of participation in these benefit plans will be provided if an employee receives an offer of employment.


Interested?  

Wilson Elser is a firm focused on its commitment to both their clients and you! Please consider joining our team by sending your credentials to Careers@wilsonelser.com and putting "NYC Paralegal" in the subject line. #LI-KR1


We believe in creating a work environment free of barriers and bias, where individual outlooks and talents are respected and valued. Our firm's policy is to ensure an equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment based on race, color, national origin, religion, age, sex, disability, citizenship, marital status, sexual orientation or any other characteristic protected by the law.

title: Residential Counselor (Part-time)
description:
**RiseWell Community Services is seeking a Part Time Residential Rehab Associates for our Residential Department.** 

**The position is Par-time with the following schedule:**

* Sat 10A-2P , Sun4p-8p & Mon 4p-8p (Day & Afternoon shifts)
* Fri from 8-4 and Sun from 2-10.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

BA in Human Services OR two years’ experience working with persons with psychiatric disabilities. Clean valid NY State Driver’s License. Fingerprinting, criminal record check, approval from NYS Office of Mental Health.

**JOB FUNCTION:**

Provide supportive counseling, restorative services, and crisis intervention to people with psychiatric disabilities in a transitional licensed residential program.

**About Us:**

RiseWell Community Services (RiseWell) is a multi-service, community-based social wellness agency and is a major provider of health and wellness, senior & children’s services, housing, and support services in Suffolk, Nassau, Queens, Brooklyn, Bronx and Manhattan. Originally comprised of an alliance of family advocacy groups, RiseWell Community Services was incorporated as a not-for-profit in 1972. For fifty years, RiseWell has developed innovative, successful programs that are designed to meet the needs of vulnerable populations, such as individuals in recovery, those living with chronic medical conditions, adult home residents, the homeless, low-income seniors and at-risk children. Since 1977, RiseWell’s mission has been to engage people with disabilities in community service and provide a wide range of programs including care coordination, housing, clinical treatment, employment, peer advocacy, and other rehabilitative services. One of RiseWell’s main goals is to improve the lives of people with disabilities and their families through education, information and referral services, legislative action and program development.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER:**  
Federation of Organizations provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, and training.

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $17.00 per hour

Work Location: In person

title: Finishing/Paint Department
description:
**Finishing/Paint Department Foreman**

Choice Cabinetry, LLC is looking for someone to join our **Finishing/ Paint Department** to add to its expanding Fabrication Department. This is a full-time position based in Somerville, NJ.

The ideal candidate will thrive in a deadline-driven environment where our skilled finishers produce high quality stained and painted wood products. The individual in this position will report to the Plant Manager.

**The ideal candidate must have:**

* Experience with staining, painting, glazing, and sample making.
* Experience with commercial-grade finishes (lacquers, high-gloss systems, etc.).
* Experience working in a large spray booth.
* Ability to produce a high-end spray finish on various materials, including but not limited to woods such as oak, maple, cherry, walnut, teak, rift cut white oak, etc.
* Experience creating and maintaining paint project schedules.
* Ability to troubleshoot quality control issues including bubbling, inconsistent color tone, rough finish, and other common finishing problems that may arise on a regular basis
* Familiarity with the kitchen cabinet industry including cabinet types, sizes, kitchen layouts and configurations, as well as knowledge of various wood parts and moldings, fillers, corbels, appliques, accessories, etc.
* Candidate may be asked to perform spray test prior to being offered employment.

**Requirements for this position include:**

* **Fluency in both** **English and Spanish** **is a plus but not a requirement**
* Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent problem-solving skills.
* The ability to stand/walk for long periods of time.
* Self-motivation and independence; the ability to simultaneously manage and complete tasks in a fast-paced industrial facility.
* The ability to work well with other shop employees to successfully move projects through the fabrication shop in an efficient manner.
* The ability to work well with others to create and maintain a positive work environment.

**Compensation**

Salary commensurate with experience.

**About Choice Cabinetry**

Choice Cabinetry is the region’s premier manufacturer of quality kitchen and bath cabinetry servicing the construction industry. Our strength is the fact that we manufacture to the specifications and needs of our clients specializing in European styling and quality at a much lower price point and quicker delivery times. Our 75,000 sq. ft. manufacturing plant has a management team with well over 100 years of combined experience manufacturing kitchen and bath cabinetry.

title: Part-time Psychotherapist
description:
**Overview**

Here at Refresh Psychotherapy, NY’s most Culturally and Clinically diverse practice, we pride ourselves on cultivating a successful private practice that values diversity in our patients and clinicians. We are looking for a passionate clinician who has a clear focus on niche clients they’d like to work with and will join the team with ideas and excitement on adding to the practice. A successful clinician in our practice has an entrepreneurial spirit, the ability to think creatively and critically, is focused on delivering quality treatment to our clients, and has the confidence needed to support the growth of the practice.

We are currently hiring for a part-time psychotherapist. The position will be a hybrid schedule, incorporating in-person services at our Brooklyn location in South Slope and work via telehealth remotely.

**Duties / Responsibilities**

* Minimum of 18 weekly sessions completed ranging from 50 and 60 minutes
* Mandatory weekly 1:1 supervision and group supervision
* Collects information about clients through interviews, observations, and assessments
* Prepares and maintains treatment records and reports
* Evaluates clients’ physical or mental conditions based on the review of client information
* Develops and implements treatment plans based on clinical experience and knowledge
* Actively participates in Refresh Psychotherapy’s social media outlets via posts, stories, and reels.

Required Skills/Abilities:

* Knowledge and understanding of clinical counseling principles, programs, and methodology
* Knowledge and regular use of evidence-based practice
* Knowledge of crisis intervention techniques
* Knowledge of clinical operations and procedures
* Interviewing and psychological/diagnostic evaluation skills
* Knowledge of psychological test administration, scoring, and interpretation
* Knowledge of legal and ethical issues related to patients’ rights
* A strong technological ability regarding telehealth
* Certificate of Professional Liability Insurance needed prior to hire
* License in New York State in good standing
* Reliable internet connection with locked Wi-Fi and VPN required

Additional Requirements:

Proof of both COVID vaccines and booster, vaccination for MMR, as well as receipt of this year’s flu shot

About you:

* Specialization in a particular subject or disorder
* An interest in continuing to learn and grow as a clinician
* A high degree of self-awareness with regard to now only how you present yourself but to the Refresh community as well, in addition to how your previous workplace and educational experiences impact your current views and behaviors
* Strong communication skills including email and workplace etiquette
* Respect for diversity within the workplace and with clients
* A strong work ethic and lack of an entitled attitude

**Education and Experience:**

* Ideally two years experience post-master’s clinical experience
* Master’s degree in Social Work, Mental Health Counseling, Marriage & Family Therapy, and Creative Arts Therapy is required.
* LMSW, LCSW, LMHC, LMFT, LCAT
* This is a W2 position that offers pay every other week via direct deposit.
* Fully licensed clinicians are paid $60 for intake evaluations and $50 for sessions and $40 for administrative time.
* Limited permit clinicians are paid $50 for intake evaluations, $40 for sessions and $40 for administration time.
* Pay rates are not negotiable.

To Apply:

Please include a resume and cover letter detailing the following to careers@refreshtherapynyc.com. Submissions without a cover letter highlighting the questions below will not be considered:

* Your interest in Refresh, specifically
* What led you to seek work in private practice?
* Desired niche or interest in private practice
* Evidence that you are a passionate self-starter and description of what motivates you towards this work
* How would you best contribute to the community as a new hire?
* Why do you love being a therapist?
* Who are you as a person?

Job Type: Part-time

Pay: $40.00 - $60.00 per hour

Expected hours: 18 – 25 per week

* Paid time off
* Retirement plan

* Monday to Friday
* Weekends as needed

Ability to Commute:

* Brooklyn, NY 11232 (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Brooklyn, NY 11232

title: Paralegal (Entry Level)
company: Pasternack Tilker Ziegler Walsh Stanton & Romano LLP
description:
For over 80 years, Pasternack Tilker Ziegler Walsh Stanton and Romano, LLP. has been defending the rights of New Yorkers. Our attorneys help hard-working people get the compensation they rightfully deserve. With 12 offices throughout the five boroughs, Long Island and Upstate New York, our firm serves clients in need of legal representation for Worker’s Compensation, Social Security Disability, Civil Service Disability Pensions, and Personal Injury claims.

We are currently seeking an experienced Paralegal to join our highly productive Social Security Disability practice. This position involves daily and constant work helping attorneys keep their cases well-organized and moving. The ideal candidate will be highly motivated, have a high standard of ethics and strong communication skills.

Duties/Responsibilities:

· Conducting claimant interviews for new cases

· Open new files, gather and analyze intake information and relevant documents.

· Heavy call volume which includes extensive contact with clients, attorneys, insurance adjusters, and medical providers, In person client appointments

· Case Management and File Reviews for preparation of upcoming hearings and settlements

· Read, interpret, and follow up on medical reports.

· Contact insurance carriers for payments and medical treatment issues.

· Performs other related duties as assigned.

Required Skills/Abilities:

· Excellent verbal and written communication skills; effectively shows empathy to claimants who are dealing with difficult circumstances.

· Upbeat with a can-do attitude; must be able to work independently and have a desire to assume significant responsibility.

· Understanding of legal language and principles, and other related matters.

· Excellent interpersonal and customer service skills.

· Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.

· Excellent time management skills with a proven ability multitask and meet deadlines.

· Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.

· Ability to function well in a high-paced and at times stressful environment.

· Ability to maintain confidentiality, and to exercise discretion and good judgment.

· Proficient with Microsoft Office Outlook, Excel, and Word.

· Fluent in Spanish is a plus.

As part of a performance-based culture, you will work alongside a team of engaged like-minded compassionate professionals. Essentially, you would support a collegian team of legal experts, dedicated to fighting hard and winning big for our clients.

If you strive for excellence and are ready to hit the ground running with one of NYC’s top-rated law firms, submit a cover letter and your resume for immediate consideration.

title: Site Lead Security Officer
description:
***Site Lead Security Officer***

*$26.00/hr*

*Located in Hudson Yards Area*

*Must have at least 2 years Security Experience and 2 years of Supervisor/Management Experience*

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**

Provides lead directions to all Security Officers assigned to the Pfizer Site on their assigned shifts.  
- Observes and reports activities and incidents, providing for the security and safety of Pfizer’s property and personnel.  
- Makes periodic tours to check for irregularities and to inspect protection devices and fire control  
equipment.  
- Preserves order and may act to enforce regulations and directives for the site pertaining to personnel,  
visitors, and premises.  
- Ensures that post orders are followed, established rounds are completed, and that adequate reports are  
filed.  
- Notifies proper authorities and Pfizer Mgt. in emergency situations.  
- May counsel and discipline personnel as appropriate; seek advice from Account Manager or designated  
representatives as appropriate; meets personally with employees and documents counseling and  
disciplinary actions.  
- Assists in the training of Security Officers and review of post orders.  
- Assists in the submission of payroll and personnel information to the company as designated.  
- In conjunction with the Account Manager or designated company representatives, acts to ensure  
adequate security coverage of all posts.  
- Prepares, files, and submits various reports as required.  
- Inspects posts as scheduled and meets with subordinates to outline tasks and responsibilities.  
- Meets with client representatives as scheduled or as needed to provide assurance that all security  
requirements are being met and to provide quality customer service.  
- Coaching and appraising performance, addressing complaints, resolving problems, and making hiring and  
termination recommendations.

**Education/Experience:** High School Diploma or G.E.D. and 2 years of related experience, or an an equivalent combination of education and experience sufficient to perform the essential functions of the job, as determined by the company. Minimum 2 years of experience in retail preferred.

**Competencies (as demonstrated through experience, training, and/or testing**):

* May be required to hold and continue to meet the requirements for any applicable state, county and municipal license for Security Officers.
* Knowledge of security operations with an emphasis on patrol, inspection and response services.
* Knowledge of supervisory practices and procedures.
* Ability to provide positive direction and motivate performance.
* Understanding of a variety of security and safety devices and controls.
* Ability to learn quickly and carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagrammatic form.
* Ability to track and maintain schedule assignments.
* Ability to be an effective team member.
* Ability to maintain professional composure when dealing with unusual circumstances.
* Courteous telephone manner.
* Ability to adapt to various sites and changes in post procedures.
* Ability to write routine correspondence, including logs and reports.
* Good organizational skills.
* Strong customer service and results orientation.
* Strong interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with clients, at various social levels and across diverse cultures.

**WORKING CONDITIONS (Physical/Mental Demands)**

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to perform effectively all essential functions. In addition to other demands, the demands of the job include:

* Maintaining composure in dealing with authorities, executives, clients, staff and the public, occasionally under conditions of urgency and in pressure situations.
* May be exposed to stressful situations, such as challenging individuals who are in or approaching an unauthorized area.
* Must undergo and meet company standards for background and reference checks, controlled substance testing, and behavioral selection survey, in addition to any mandatory licensing requirements.
* Directing and disciplining staff in a positive manner.
* May be required to work overtime without advance notice.
* Required ability to handle multiple tasks concurrently.
* Keyboarding, basic computer usage, and operating controls.
* Seeing, hearing, speaking and writing clearly in order to communicate with employees and clients, observe and report incidents, and direct others.
* Frequent sitting, standing, and walking, which may be required for long periods of time, and may involve climbing stairs and walking up inclines and on uneven terrain.
* Occasional reaching with hands and arms, stooping, kneeling, crouching and crawling.
* Frequent lifting and/or moving up to 10 pounds and occasionally up to 25 pounds.
* Close vision, distance vision, and ability to adjust focus.
* Regular use of vehicle for the performance of duties.
* On occasion may be required to perform stressful and physical activity.
* Depending upon assignment may be exposed to inclement weather or be required to work in environments or under conditions that require the use of protective gear and devices and/or awareness of personal safety and safety of others.
* May be exposed to or required to handle sensitive and confidential information.

EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabilities

title: Wellness Sales Manager
description:
**Company Overview:**  

Do you want to be on the forefront of regenerative medicine, medical aesthetics, and hormone therapy? Empire Portfolio Group, the company that helped Orangetheory Fitness become the fastest growing fitness franchise in the world, is now setting its sights on personalized health, wellness and anti-aging. Empire, in partnership with Relive Health, will be launching dozens of medical wellness centers around the country and we're looking for top talent who are fanatical about transforming people's lives.  

  

**Who we are looking for:**  

The Sales Manager is responsible for the sale of products and services to clients. They must possess complete knowledge of all products and services. This individual is the direct point of contact with clients and ensures that their needs and expectations are fully met and they are completely satisfied throughout their relationship with the wellness center.  

  

**Role and Responsibilities:**  

* Acquisition of new clients through the follow-up of lead generation, referrals, marketing efforts and events.
* Serves existing clients through follow-up of effectiveness of current plans, monitoring results and feedback.
* Understanding client needs and providing personalized solutions to meet their requirements, effectively positioning our services or treatments that best fit.
* Identify opportunities for upselling or cross selling our services or treatments to existing clients, maximizing revenue potential.
* Ability to showcase features, benefits, and value of our services and treatments offered.
* Meets and exceeds sales goals.
* Provides feedback on the effectiveness of marketing plans.
* Full understanding of all services/ products/ operating systems
* Answers clients’ questions regarding products, services, and pricing
* Resolves client complaints and queries.
* Submits purchase orders and informs management of purchase actions.
* Maintains patient files with appropriate follow up and update

  

**Qualifications/Education Requirements and Work Environment:**  

* High school diploma or equivalent education required. Bachelor’s degree is preferred.
* 1 year plus of general sales experience. Sales experience in Aesthetics or n Hormone Replacement Therapy is a plus.
* Persuasion, negotiation, and closing skills.
* Ability to meet deadlines, multi task, achieve company set objectives
* Maintain patience and composure managing client care
* Ability to work productively and effectively in an unsupervised environment
* Possesses strong interpersonal and communications skills

  

**Job Type: Full-time**  

**Compensation:**  

$60,000 yearly with a bonus potential of 1% top line revenue  

  

**Benefits & Beyond the Paycheck:**  

* Complimentary services and employee discounts with Orangetheory Fitness and Relive Health
* Empire cares about you—we offer access to free mental health counseling
* Discounts on theme parks, travel, movies, etc. through LifeMart and TicketsAtWork
* 401(k)
* Medical, Dental and Vision insurance
* Employee discounts
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Pre-tax commuter benefit plan to save on public transportation to/from work

  

**Our Mission:** To bring out your best life through inspiring, motivating and exceptional moments  

**Vision:** To be the premier wellness portfolio that supercharges everyday life  

**Values:** Happy, Hungry, Humble, Healthy & Human  

  

**About Empire:**  

Empire Portfolio Group™ was founded in 2013 with a vision to develop strong brands and supercharge their long-term growth. In an increasingly crowded and competitive industry, our team not only outperforms the norm but most importantly prioritizes making differences in team and studio members' lives.  

  

Headquartered in New York City, Empire Portfolio Group is a leading Area Representative and franchisee of Orangetheory Fitness. The Company owns, operates and supports 140+ Orangetheory Fitness studios across DC, Connecticut, Maine, New Hampshire, New Jersey, New York, North Carolina, South Carolina, Vermont, and Virginia. Empire is also launching Relive Health which provides anti-aging and wellness services which include hormone optimization, medical aesthetics, vitamin therapy, and regenerative medicine. Empire plans to open hundreds of locations across a dozen states in the next few years. The mission of Relive Health is to help people take control of their "healthspan" (the length of time that a person stays healthy) through personalized wellness products and services.  

*This franchise is independently owned and operated by a franchisee. Your application will go directly to the franchisee, and all hiring decisions will be made by the management of this franchisee. All inquiries about employment at this franchisee should be made directly to the franchise location, and not to RELIVE Corporate.*

title: Care Manager
description:
**Care Manager Immediate Hire (Bronx, Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens)**

Care Management is a service model whereby all an individual's caregivers communicate and interface so that the patient's needs are addressed in a comprehensive manner. This is done primarily through a "Care Manager" who oversees and provides access to all the services an individual’s needs to ensure that they receive everything necessary to prevent hospitalizations, stay healthy, and maintain stability.

* Provide daily oversight of an assigned panel of high-need candidates/members, delivering interventions designed to reduce unnecessary emergency department (ED)/emergency room (ER) and inpatient (IP) utilization, increase connection to primary care/behavioral health care, and demonstrate improved health outcomes for the served population. Communicate changes in member’s status (e.g., mental health, medical, social determinants impacting health and wellness) to the care team
* Administer program requirements as defined by all applicable federal, state, local, and agency guidelines (e.g., assessments, care plans, documentation of services, etc.) and other Health Home documentation required to address member needs.
* Monitor alerts (e.g., hospital admission/discharge, incarceration, ER/ED visit, etc.) and provide onsite follow up with members promptly, verifying appropriate levels of care and access to all needed medications, therapies, and supports in managing care transitions*.*
* Provide regular, field based face-to-face visits with members/candidates and providers in home and /or community settings, ensuring core services and HML are completed monthly.
* Participate in case conferences as needed to ensure that each member’s care team is aligned with a shared plan of care and up-to-date information on each member. Provide written status updates on a regular basis as requested (case conference tool, emails, etc.) and verify documentation of all such activities in member chart.
* Adhere to timeframes and quality standards regarding completion of member assessments, reassessments, care plans, progress notes and documentation standards.
* Manage schedule to allow for adequate field time, travel time, and time to complete administrative duties of position. Maintain communication with supervisor on changes in schedule.
* Maintain positive partnerships with providers and clinics
* Maintain a directory of provider services including medical, behavioral health, social support, and other services as needed to support referral and coordination activities of assigned members. Identify valuable resources to share with the rest of the team to the benefit of all members.
* Maintain positive and productive personal presentation within and outside of the assigned hub/office(s), ensuring all engagements with leadership, staff/coworkers, members, and community partners are professional, courteous, and respectful.
* Develop and maintain expertise in working within the assigned Electronic Health Record System(s) of the agency as well as city and state DOH resources; utilize the system daily and as needed to manage secure messages, charting needs, and all core functions of position. Support/coach team members as needed to enhance their capabilities in this area.
* Attend community meetings, committees, and trainings as requested; maintain and promote a positive image of the agency, department, and hub with the goal of fostering positive community relations to the benefit of the served members and agency mission at large.
* May attend outside meetings or conferences and or other duties as deemed necessary.

**Minimum Qualifications**

Minimum of 2 years’ experience in care coordination, care management, case work, with chronically ill, HIV/AIDS, homelessness, and substance abuse patients managing chronic health conditions and social needs. Or 5 years’ experience if the bachelor’s degree is not in one of the above listed concentrations.

1. Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (including but not limited to Word, Outlook, Excel)

2. Proficiency/experience working within electronic health record (EHR) systems.

3. Care Managers are based in Harlem office. Must travel between assigned work sites as needed.

4. Solid organizational and follow-up skills.

5. Computer Literacy learn and adapt to different IT platforms.

6. Excellent interpersonal skills.

7. Ability to manage and work with a variety of different people.

8. Flexibility to travel throughout the 5 Boroughs.

9. Maintain confidentiality / PHI/PII & HIPPA.

10. Capable of clear direct communication with others (oral and written).

11. **Bilingual (English/Spanish/Arabic/Russian is a plus**

**Thank you for your interest in CABS Homecare! We look forward to receiving your submission!**

description:
At Armanino, you determine your career path. This means it's possible to pursue challenges you are passionate about, in industries you care about.
Armanino is proud to be Among the top 20 Largest Firms in the Nation and one of the Best Places to Work. We have a community of resources that are ready and willing to support your ideas, build your skills and expand your professional network. We want you to integrate all aspects of your life with your career. At Armanino, we know you don’t check-out of life when you check-in at work. That’s why we’ve created a unique work environment where your passions, work, and family & friends can overlap. We want to help you achieve growth by giving you access to a network of smart and supportive people, willing to listen to your ideas.
Job Responsibilities* Assist the Senior Operations Manager and/or Business Unit Lead with Key Initiatives and Strategic Objectives throughout the year with support via processes, reporting, monitoring, and follow-up.
* Lead efforts for system implementations, process enhancements, and initiatives to support the complexities of continued department growth.
* Communicates key action deliverables with subject matter experts from across the firm related to Department initiatives.
* Conduct research and analysis for projects and initiatives and present findings to project teams and subject matter experts.
* Generate, develop and refine reports and metrics to help manage operations efficiently and track the departments progress toward targeted metrics and goals.
* Identify areas for improvement in processes and systems development and propose efficiency-enhancing solutions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure alignment on projects/processes and develop and maintain strong relationships across the firm.

* Excellent project management and time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines, prioritize tasks, and follow-up when necessary.

* Ability to project manage, think independently and problem solve in a result driven, team-oriented environment.

* Maintains a high degree of professionalism.
* Ability to interface with all levels of the organization as a primary point of contact for the Department
* Works well independently as well as in a collaborative team environment.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

title: Elementary Group Leader

description:
**Job Description**

**JOB TITLE:** GROUP LEADER  
**REPORTS TO:** Program Director (Site Coordinator)  
**PROGRAM:** AFTER-SCHOOL PROGRAMS/Summer Rising Programs  
**DEPARTMENT:** School-Based Programs  
**POSITION:** PART TIME  
**SALARY RANGE:** $16 -$18, PART TIME

The SoBRO Center for Education and Career Development offers successful, exciting, cutting-edge programs for youth and adults. The Center’s mission is to engage youth, adults, and family groups in career exploration, leadership development, educational and employment opportunities to achieve economic independence. SoBRO is seeking skilled and dedicated individuals with strong commitment to enhancing the quality of life in the South Bronx by providing innovative, outcomes based activities.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Manage a group of youth and provide homework assistance
* Develop and implement project-based lesson plans and activities in area of expertise that enrich academic learning, as well as foster and develop social and emotional skills for students
* Assist with facilitating Science/Literacy/Math based projects for youth
* Lead and assist in all activities such as snack, dismissal, academic and extra-curricular activities
* Attend community service projects, events and chaperone field trips etc.
* Provide opportunities for students to showcase work
* Maintain accurate participant attendance, activity and sign-out records
* Document student progress and behavior
* Uphold program policies and procedures and proper use of supplies and materials
* Maintain classroom cleanliness and organization
* Attend staff meetings, professional development workshops (minimum 30 hours) and program events
* Be willing to create and facilitate lesson plans in person and remotely via google classroom, zoom and any platform that is needed to operate program
* Perform other duties as assigned by the Program Director

**Qualifications and Other Responsibilities:**

* High School Diploma/Associates’ degree(required) in child development, elementary/secondary education, physical education, recreation or a related field; Bachelors’ degree preferred
* Two years direct experience working with children under the age of 13 years
* Experience working with under-served populations and in after-school settings
* Exceptional interpersonal, and superior written and oral communication skills

*SoBRO is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply.*

* Exceptional group management, problem-solving and conflict resolution skills
* Must have the ability to demonstrate and/or show competency in areas of Youth Development principles and social-emotional learning activities
* Ability to create interactive academic and/or enrichment activities that are age-appropriate
* Ability to make sound decisions to secure the safety and wellbeing of all program participants.
* Knowledge of NYC DOH/OCFS Part 414 regulations, DOE’s Chancellor’s Regulations and Common

Core Standards

* Must have State Central Review (SCR), Staff Exclusion List (SEL) and Criminal Background clearance and all additional DOH clearances prior to employment, as well as maintaining background clearance throughout employment
* Must have Medical Clearance within two weeks of employment

**COVID-19 On-Site Safety Regulations:**

* Must have COVID-19 Vaccination.
* All staff must wear a mask or face covering at all times and be prepared to undergo school’s safety regulation upon entering the building daily.
* School or Site may require staff to get tested weekly, or monthly and you must adhere to continue work at that particular site location.
* Get familiar with COVID-19 school health policy for programs inside of school buildings
* Promote behaviors that reduce spread such as distancing, wearing face coverings and adhering to signage and floor markings
* Maintain healthy environment and cleanliness such as keeping hands clean, building space usage and disinfecting all on a consistent basis
* Recognize symptoms and be prepared to report
* Obey COVID-19 school model and regulations and program schedule based on regulations

**Hours**

* **School-Year- Monday-Friday, 2:00 p.m. through 6:00 p.m.** or 16-20 hours per week
* **Summer Hours: Monday -Friday, Ranges between hours of 8:00am to 6:00pm; up to 35 hours per week.**
* Occasional weekend and evening hours

*SoBRO is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We encourage all qualified individuals to apply.*

title: Dental Assistant
description:
Department: Operations  
Reports to: Dental Practice Manager  
FLSA Status: Non-Exempt

**Dental Health North Brunswick** is in search of an energetic, motivated, and organized **Dental Assistant.** If building your career as a Dental Assistant interests you, and you want to work in an enjoyable and fun environment that promotes learning and teamwork, look no further. We offer up-to-date equipment and technology, training, experienced and friendly staff, and dentists who truly care about their patients. Our Dental Assistant positions offer competitive compensation and benefits packages that include medical, vision, dental, 401(k), more!

ProSmile is the fastest growing dental organization on the East Coast and has the largest network of affiliated multi-specialty dental practices in New Jersey, with an expanding footprint in Pennsylvania and Maryland. Our premier DSO is led by world class dentists who understand what highly skilled dentists and dental professionals need to grow a practice while focusing on delivering the best-in-class clinical care to their patients.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

* Assisting the Dentist in rendering patient care chairside
* Maintaining inventory control in the operatories where treatment is rendered by the Provider
* Adhering to OSHA, HIPAA, and CDC guidelines
* Patient interactions related to scheduling, follow up treatment and record keeping
* Maintaining public area appearance

**Qualifications**

* High School diploma or GED **Required**
* Easily able to learn new technologies and systems required
* Applicable licensing required for the state in which you will work:
* **For NJ - Dental Radiologic Technologist (DRT)) license or willing to pursue licensure immediately Required.**
* Certified Dental Assistant certificate preferred
* 1+ years work experience as a Dental Assistant preferred
* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment
* Requires some flexibility in scheduling, such as the ability to work evenings and weekends as needed

**Benefits**

Our staff work diligently to deliver quality care to our patients. They are the key to fulfilling our mission! Perks of being part of a team who is keen to their individual growth, our staff members can enjoy our unique benefits package including:

**Full Time**

* We provide above industry standards for Personal Protective Equipment (PPE)
* Competitive pay
* Health & Dental insurance
* Dental discounts
* PTO
* Paid Holidays
* 401k Retirement
* Opportunities for growth
* Continuing education
* Flexible schedule
* Training support
* Fun and collaborative environment

**Equal Employment**

Our culture encourages individual development, embraces an inclusive environment, rewards innovative excellence, and leads in provider and patient satisfaction. Prosmile values diversity, inclusion, and equity as matters of fairness and effectiveness. We are committed to hiring and retaining a staff that reflects the diversity of the communities we serve, fostering an inclusive working environment where staff of all backgrounds feel welcomed and engaged.

ProSmile is an Equal Opportunity Employer and encourages applications from individuals underrepresented in the medical sector, including people of color, and persons with non-traditional work and educational experience. All who believe they meet the stated qualifications are invited to apply.

**Company Safety**

We believe that the best care for our patients starts with the best care for our employees. ProSmile is committed to proactively creating and maintaining an environment that is safe for our team and patients. Employees are required to wear Personal Protective Equipment (PPE) including face masks, gloves, gowns, and more as needed and in accordance with CDC standards.

title: Per Diem Registered Nurse
description:
The Center’s mission is to help children and adults with differing abilities achieve their dreams. We do this by offering programs that support people with disabilities to live, work, learn and enjoy recreational opportunities in the community of their choice.

Our vision is to support people through teams that are dedicated to the achievement of excellence and innovation, embraced within a community based upon respect, kindness and open communication.

Center for Developmental Disabilities Values:

* Everyone is treated with dignity and respect.
* People are supported to reach their unique and maximum potential.
* Individual choices are encouraged and incorporated into everyday life.

Join a caring and supportive group of nurses in the field of intellectual and developmental disabilities whose focus is on providing the highest quality nursing care by advocating, educating, and promoting optimal health.

Our work environment includes:

* Group home settings.
* Flexible working hours.
* Supportive nursing team.

At the Center, we embrace diverse voices and value the seen and unseen qualities that make each person unique. We are committed to the advocacy for people with disabilities through the creation of a community based upon full inclusion and equity. Our commitment to DEI learning facilitates opportunities and growth for our employees so that the people we support may thrive.

**Some Job Responsibilities:**

* Coordinationof medical services.
* Assess patient's health status and develop individualized plans of nursing services.
* Monitor and document patient's condition and response to medications and treatments.
* Initial certification/annual recertification of Approved Medication Assistive Personnel.
* Educate staff, individuals and their families about health maintenance and prevention.
* Maintain accurate medical records.

The ideal candidate will have passion for helping others, excellent communication skills, and the ability to work independently as well as in a team setting.

**Job Qualifications:**

* Valid NYS RN license
* Experience working with individuals with intellectual and/or developmental disabilities preferred
* Valid NYS Driver’s License.
* Must be able to sit, stand, lift 50 lbs.

title: Chaperone (Part time)
description:
**About Columbia University Fertility Center (CUFC):**

Columbia University Fertility Center is one of the preeminent fertility centers in the U.S. We are a team of compassionate and dedicated physicians, nurses, embryologists, scientists, technicians, medical assistants, patient financial coordinators, and others, all working together to provide exceptional care to our patients and help them achieve their dreams of building a family.

Our purpose is to bring life into the world. We have a proud history that goes back decades, and have been growing rapidly thanks to our amazing team. We offer great benefits, opportunities for continued personal and professional development, and a very supportive environment. We are looking for individuals who want to join our team and grow together.

**About the role:**

We have an exciting **entry-level position** at the Columbia University Fertility Center! We are looking for a chaperone to assist with our daily morning monitoring and join our mission of helping patients build their dream family. This position is part-time and ideal for someone already working/studying in the NYC area who can commit 4-5 hours **Monday-Friday (7 am-12 pm)**. There may eventually be an opportunity for the right candidate to take on more hours and grow within the division.

Specific Duties and Responsibilities

* Chaperone physicians in exam rooms.
* Assist in unpacking and restocking supplies.
* Turn over rooms between patients and assist with exam/procedure room maintenance
* Assist with the preparation of paperwork required for monitoring and appointments
* Conforms to applicable HIPAA, Billing compliance and safety guidelines.
* Pregnancy Scans
* Related duties as assigned.

Knowledge and Experience

* High School Diploma or GED.
* 1 year of medical office, general office, customer service, or related experience
* Computer experience essential
* Must be able to commit to the role for at least a year.
