description:
**About Legends**



Founded in 2008, Legends is a holistic experiential services agency with more than 1,300 full-time and 20,000 seasonal team members globally. Legends has three core divisions operating worldwide: Global Planning, Global Sales and Hospitality, offering clients and partners a 360-degree platform to elevate their brand and execute their vision. Currently, Legends works with marquee clients across business verticals including professional sports; collegiate; attractions; entertainment; and conventions and leisure. We are the industry leaders in designing, planning and realizing exceptional experiences in sports and entertainment. For more information, visit Legends.net and follow Legends at Facebook.com/TheLegendsWay,Twitter and Instagram: @thelegendsway.



Merchandise Associate



Our retail employees are responsible for creating the ultimate game day experience for the fan. Our number one priority is to provide fans with a legendary experience each time they enter the store. We strive to create an environment unlike any other sporting event world-wide. We go above and beyond to exceed their expectations in customer service, display of merchandise, and attention to detail. If you have a passion for retail, an outgoing personality, love to sell, enjoy working in teams and strive to create relationships with the fans, this is the place for you.

* Merchandising skills a plus

  

Qualifications  

  

* Honesty and integrity in all actions and language
* Must be able to take constructive feedback &make necessary changes
* Excellent customer service and selling skills
* Be willing to work extended hours on event days
* Must be able to work weekends & overtime as needed

Practice safe work habits, follow all safety policies and procedures and regulations, complete company-wide safety training and any additional job specific safety training.  

  

Legends is an Equal Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, or genetic information.

**$17.05/Hourly**

title: North America Data Transformation Lead -S4HANA
description:
Job Description

**Are You Ready to Make It Happen at Mondelēz International?**

**Join our Mission to Lead the Future of Snacking. Make It Matter.**


Be a pivotal part of our transformation journey as a Regional Transformation Lead. With our adoption of cutting-edge platforms like S4/HANA and o9, we're harmonizing business processes and data globally. Collaborate across functions, to drive this transformation. Your role will focus on leading regional data harmonization, governance, cleansing and migration tasks to ensure a smooth transition to the new system, ensuring collaboration between Global and Local Business.

***\\*\\*\\* The role is 100% remote but ideal candidate will be located near our East Hanover, New Jersey office and able to be on-site when needed.***

**Job Responsibilities**

* Lead, manage, and mentor a team of regional subject matter experts (SME) responsible for various data domains.
* Responsible for appropriate staffing of Regional Data Team.
* Assess Global design and lead regional adoption, facilitate cross-functional alignment within the Region in partnership with Global Governance, and act as point of escalation when applicable.
* Identify and implement data harmonization opportunities at the regional level in collaboration with the Global Data Governance Team.
* Oversee Data Object Scope at the regional level, ensuring alignment with global standards and objectives.
* Act as primary point of contact for the stakeholders in terms of any regional matter related to data.
* Accountable for full scope of data migration, data process definition, stablishing of data governance including regional data owner identification.
* Lead design and implementation of regional data orchestration processes based on local tax, legal and/or regulatory requirements.
* Manage all Regional data migration workshops and discussions.
* Oversee data cleansing activities in collaboration with Regional Business Functions and Data Team, ensuring adherence to project milestones delivery.
* Accountable for seamless cutover plan execution, Data Freeze Strategy, Data Cleansing execution, Data Validation, Defect Management, Testing and Training.
* Review that CDDs/KDEs are consistent with the global and regional governance model in partnership with Global Data Domain Migration Lead and functions.
* In collaboration with the Data Governance Office (DGO) and Global Process & Governance team, lead efforts to establish governance processes for Master Data and emerging data areas, such as reference data.
* Proactively address any risks associated with the data activities at Regional Level.
* Provide regular reporting and status updates to stakeholders, keeping them informed of progress, milestones, and any potential issues or challenges. Foster open communication channels to facilitate transparency and collaboration.

**Candidate Profile**


The ideal candidate should possess a diverse skill set and demonstrate a strong commitment to excellence in fulfilling the requirements of the role:

* Deep knowledge of regional specifics for the respective domain(s) in terms of SAP data management, data quality, solutions landscape, business processes, and stakeholders.
* Holistic understanding of Mondelēz business processes and exhibit expertise in functional business processes, supported by a robust understanding of SAP data.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office solutions, including SharePoint, Teams, Excel, and PowerPoint, leveraging these tools to facilitate communication, collaboration, and documentation throughout the project lifecycle.
* People Management experience.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with diverse stakeholders across business and technical functions to achieve project milestones.
* Excellent proficiency in written and verbal communication in English and at least one of the most spoken languages within the region, with the ability to articulate complex ideas clearly and concisely to diverse stakeholders.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into practical data solutions and driving results in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Proven experience in data management, with a focus on data process, governance, and quality, preferably in the context of SAP S4/HANA implementations in multinational FMCG environment
* Experience with data cataloging, cleansing and migration tools and techniques, as well as metadata management principles.
* Familiarity with regulatory requirements and compliance standards related to data migration.
* Strong track record of driving change and innovation, with the ability to think outside the box and embrace an agile and growth mindset.
* Result-oriented with a strong focus on delivering high-quality outcomes.
* Proactive and adaptable, with the ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.

**What extra ingredients you will bring**

**Required Experience:**

* 10+ years of data management experience.
* 7+ of CPG industry experience.
* SAP implementation experience.

**Preferred Experience:**

* Supply chain/Finance/SAP o9 systems experience preferred.
* S4HANA implementation experience.

**Education/Certifications:**

* Bachelor's degree required.

**Travel requirements:**

* Minimal travel.


Country to country Relocation support available through our Global Mobility Policies

The United States is the largest market in the Mondelēz International family with a significant employee and manufacturing footprint. Here, weproduce our well-loved household favorites to provide our consumers with the right snack, at the right moment, made the right way. We have corporate offices, sales, manufacturing and distribution locations throughout the U.S. to ensure our iconic brands—including *Oreo* and *Chips Ahoy!* cookies, *Ritz*, *Wheat Thins* and *Triscuit* crackers, and *Swedish Fish* and *Sour Patch**Kids* confectionery products —are close at hand for our consumers across the country.

title: Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Internal Audit Internship Program – IT Track
description:
Job Classification:
Technology - Engineering & Cloud
Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Internal Audit Internship Program – IT Track  

Location:
Newark, NJ; (Hybrid)  

Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.  

Are you looking for a career that helps you apply your passion for information technology, computer science, financial services businesses, and data analysis to influence the evaluation of the Company’s operations, processes, and business decisions? Are you interested in being a part of an exciting internship program that is focused on developing technical and professional skills, working with diverse teams on challenging projects, current technologies and collaborating alongside Prudential’s business leaders? If you are results driven, enjoy working on a team, have a passion for working with data, and are intellectually curious, then Prudential’s Internal Audit Internship is the place for you!  

Internal Audit protects Prudential and its businesses and support functions from current and emerging risks by applying systematic controls, processes and governance as well as promoting a strong ethical culture. You will participate on actual audit projects that test technology and/or business processes and controls, perform data analytics, directly apply coursework, and generate key enhancements that uncover and report trends to Prudential leaders, anticipate emerging risks and provide solutions to protect us from key risks.  

Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.  

We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled. *Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd**.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.  

Your Day-to-Day:  

As an intern you will learn about the company’s business objectives and understand how we approach risk management to achieve our mission to Protect Prudential. The 10-week Internal Audit Internship Program will provide you with valuable professional and personal development experiences within the following four key stages of an audit engagement:  

1. Audit planning and Data collection
2. Scoping (Risk identification and Control Evaluation)
3. Control Testing
4. Issue Development and Audit Reporting
There are opportunities to work as a summer intern in our Technology Audit Group as well as one of our Traditional Audit Groups. You will have the option to choose your preference during the recruitment process.
Some day-to-day responsibilities from each area could include:* IT interns will have the opportunity to work on audits and gain knowledge about technologies like Splunk, Hadoop, Robotic Process Automation and more. Technology focused applicants can be placed in IT audit which focuses on projects that provide exposure to risks related to software development like Agile, DevOps, cybersecurity, and cloud related platforms.
  

Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2027
* Preferred majors include Information Technology, Information Security, Risk Management, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, and Statistics; or double majors in one of these fields with Accounting as a second area of focus
* Minimum 3.0 GPA recommended
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration
  

Preferred Qualifications:* Strong mathematical aptitude and computer skills
* Strong written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills
  

Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.  

For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.  

Note: The pay range for this role is $32.00 to $34.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. title: Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Internal Audit Internship Program
description:
Job Classification:
Finance & Accounting - Finance & Accounting
Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Internal Audit Internship Program  

Location:
Newark, NJ (Hybrid)
Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.  

Are you looking for a career that helps you apply your passion for information technology, computer science, financial services businesses, and data analysis to influence the evaluation of the Company’s operations, processes, and business decisions? Are you interested in being a part of an exciting internship program that is focused on developing technical and professional skills, working with diverse teams on challenging projects, current technologies and collaborating alongside Prudential’s business leaders? If you are results driven, enjoy working on a team, have a passion for working with data, and are intellectually curious, then Prudential’s Internal Audit Internship is the place for you!  

Internal Audit protects Prudential and its businesses and support functions from current and emerging risks by applying systematic controls, processes and governance as well as promoting a strong ethical culture. You will participate on actual audit projects that test technology and/or business processes and controls, perform data analytics, directly apply coursework, and generate key enhancements that uncover and report trends to Prudential leaders, anticipate emerging risks and provide solutions to protect us from key risks.  

Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.  

We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled. *Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd**.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.  

Your Day to Day:
As an intern you will learn about the company’s business objectives and understand how we approach risk management to achieve our mission to Protect Prudential. The 10-week Internal Audit Internship Program will provide you with valuable professional and personal development experiences within the following four key stages of an audit engagement:
1. Audit planning and Data collection
2. Scoping (Risk identification and Control Evaluation)
3. Control Testing
4. Issue Development and Audit Reporting
There are opportunities to work as a summer intern in our Technology Audit Group as well as one of our Traditional Audit Groups. You will have the option to choose your preference during the recruitment process. Some day-to-day responsibilities from each area could include:* Interns focused on non-IT audits will gain exposure to one or more key risk areas including sales practices, operations, capital adequacy, liquidity, and models. In addition, you will apply audit techniques to learn about Prudential’s investment and insurance businesses and/or corporate functions such as Treasurers and the Chief Investment Office
  

Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2027
* Preferred majors include Information Technology, Computer Science, Quantitative Finance, Mathematics, Finance, and Statistics; or double majors in one of these fields with Accounting as a second area of focus.
* Minimum 3.0 GPA recommended
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration
  

Preferred Qualifications:* Strong mathematical aptitude and computer skills
* Strong written, oral communication, and interpersonal skills
  

Our Application Process:  

Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.  

For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.  

Note: The pay range for this role is $32.00 to $34.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Manager, Planning & Analysis - Tech & Data
description:
Job Classification:
Finance & Accounting - Finance & Accounting
At Prudential, we believe talent is key to achieving our vision. When you join Prudential, you’ll unlock a motivating and impactful career – all while growing your skills and advancing your profession at one of the world’s leading financial services institutions!
Are you a highly motivated, resourceful, and skilled individual? The Tech and Data Finance Organization is looking for a Manager of Planning and Analysis to join the team! The T&D function within Prudential is on a multi-year, multi-phase journey to modernize our technology. This will empower Prudential’s customers, advisors and employees with tech-forward and data-enabled experiences that deliver meaningful, differentiated outcomes.
In support of that journey, the Manager will report to the Director of Planning and Analysis. You will also support the Chief Data Office, a key pillar on the Tech and Data multi-year journey to deliver Data and Data Science capabilities. You will provide meaningful, insightful, and actionable analytics on investments in technology for the Chief Data Office. This will entail the development of a multi-year forecast projection of operational, strategic and future of work investments in technology for the businesses, the reporting of technology spending and outcomes against plans and business requirements, and clear and crisp articulation of opportunities, risks and challenges to business plans. This role will be a key partner to the Chief Data Officer technology leaders as well as to other business leaders to drive strategic decision making.  

What you can expect:* Lead the P&A and monthly financial reporting functions for the Tech and Data Finance Chief Data Office organization
* Lead the development of the multi-year Tech and Data budget/forecast for the Chief Data Office
* Strategically partner with the Tech and Data Chief Data Office through development of insightful business plans and analytics to drive decision making and facilitate management actions, as appropriate
* Support the identification of and drive technology expense efficiencies Developing and articulating an in-depth understanding of expense drivers, accounting for capitalization of technology assets, key performance indicators, AOI, GAAP and STAT earnings, cash flows, balance sheet and capital
* Develop strong business case cost/benefit analysis for financial evaluation of strategic priorities/initiatives within the Chief Data Office businesses. In addition, measuring benefits against expectations
* Collaborate across multi-functional teams in the organization to support strategic objectives for Chief Data Office technology initiatives
* Create clear and concise management presentations to ensure key messages are captured and action steps are well defined to enable swift decision making
* Support the design and implementation of enhancements to key technology processes, including expense allocations/chargebacks for the Chief Data Office business. Respond to chargeback queries from business.
* Willingness to roll up sleeves and navigate through areas that may not be in direct line of responsibility to transform strategy into action

  

What you'll need:* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related field
* 5 years of relevant experience
* Prior experience in Planning and Business Analysis
* Excellent collaborator with communication skills that enable the ability to translate financial topics into business English
* Discretion to deal with confidential information
* Excellent analytical skills with strong ability to problem solve and proactively improve upon existing processes
* Agile and organized, structure-oriented individual with ability to appropriately prioritize and juggle many competing deliverables
* Ability to proactively anticipate issues, provide recommendations, and communicate key issues at the right level at the right time
* Sense of urgency – Priorities may require quick turn-around for senior preview and presentations.


It'd be a plus if you had:* MBA or CPA
* Experience with Workday and Anaplan tools


At Prudential, you can:
We equip and empower our employees to expand their skills and experience by using powerful learning, gigs, and job opportunities. We offer a suite of services such as on demand resources and networking to propel your career forward.
We’re a global organization, full of outstandingly dedicated people who aren’t afraid to think differently, challenge the status quo and take sensible risks along the way. You will enjoy pushing boundaries as we build innovative technology that helps clients, customers and employees live their best lives. You will have access to leadership and learning opportunities and the resources needed to take your career in any direction. We will help you do your best work, offering flexibility, while delivering on our Purpose.
What we offer you:* Market competitive base salaries, with a yearly bonus potential at every level
* Medical, dental, vision, life insurance, disability insurance, Paid Time Off (PTO), and leave of absences, such as parental and military leave
* Retirement plans:
* 401(k) plan with company match (up to 4%)
* Company-funded pension plan
* Wellness Programs to help you achieve your wellbeing goals, including up to $1,600 a year for reimbursement of items purchased to support personal wellbeing needs
* Work/Life Resources to help support topics such as parenting, housing, senior care, finances, pets, legal matters, education, emotional and mental health, and career development.
* Tuition Assistance to help finance traditional college enrollment toward obtaining an approved degree, many accredited certificate programs, and industry designations.
* Employee Stock Purchase Plan: Shares can be purchased at 85% of the lower of two prices (Beginning or End of the purchase period), after one year of service.


To find out more about our Total Reward package, see our Total Rewards Brochure. Some of the above benefits may not apply to part-time employees scheduled to work less than 20 hours per week.
Note: Prudential is required by state specific laws to include the salary range for this role when hiring a resident in applicable locations. The salary range for this role is from $115,800.00 to $172,300.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance. In addition, employees are eligible for standard benefits package including paid time off, medical, dental and retirement.

title: Registered Nurse | Queens | Weekends
description:
**Job Title:** CHHA Field RN | Queens | Weekends

**Client:** Home Healthcare Agency

**Location:** Queens

**Schedule:** Fri (12.75hr shift, Sat (13hr shift), and Mon (13hr shift)

**Salary:** Beginning at $95,000

 **Company Overview:**


A distinguished Home Healthcare Agency based in New York with a coveted 5 Star Rating for excellence in Patient Care, as recognized by Medicare & Medicaid Services, who is committed to delivering top-tier services, specializing in skilled nursing, physical therapy, and pharmacy assistance - focusing on aiding seniors in maintaining their independence at home.

 **Responsibilities:**


Evaluate the eligibility of patients for homecare services.


Providing direct patient care in a homecare setting


Conduct orientation and provide supervision for home health aide personnel.


Actively engage in Quality Improvement initiatives to enhance patient care quality.

 **Qualifications:**

**Candidate must have hospital experience.**


Open to recent nursing graduates w/6 months nursing experience.


Successful completion of an accredited school of professional nursing.


Possession of a current RN license in the state of New York (NYS).


Previous experience in the home care field/pediatrics is very advantageous.


Proficiency in either Cantonese or Mandarin is a valuable asset.


Candidate must drive.

 **Benefits:**


Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision coverage.


401K Matching.


Life Insurance coverage.

**Join the team of dedicated professionals who are committed to making a positive difference in the lives of patients!**

*Queens, New York, is a melting pot of cultures, cuisines, and creativity, offering a dynamic tapestry of experiences for residents and visitors alike. From the serene beauty of Flushing Meadows Corona Park to the bustling streets of Astoria and Jackson Heights, Queens is a vibrant borough bursting with energy and diversity. Home to iconic landmarks like the Unisphere and the Queens Museum, as well as world-renowned institutions like MoMA PS1, Queens is a cultural hub where innovation thrives. With its rich history, thriving arts scene, and welcoming communities, Queens exemplifies the best of New York City's spirit, making it a place where dreams are nurtured and possibilities abound.*

title: PGIM: 2025 Operations & Innovation, Investment Operations Analyst Program
description:
Job Classification:
Investment Management - Investment Operations
PGIM: 2025 Operations & Innovation, Investment Operations Analyst Program (Newark, NJ)
Location(s): Newark, NJ
PGIM is the diversified asset management business of Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU). With $1.3 trillion in assets under management, and 41 offices spanning 20 countries, PGIM is among the world’s leading asset managers. Comprised of seven self-governing asset management divisions, PGIM offers a distinct workplace culture that aligns with the firm’s ultimate objective: to provide premier service to our clients while fostering an inclusive workplace culture that is rooted in trust, respect, and equality. PGIM was ranked #3 in Pensions & Investments Best Places to Work in Money Management in 2023. Prudential is a fully inclusive workplace: we value the unique perspectives and experiences of every individual, and we work hard ensure to Prudential is a welcoming and rewarding place to work for people of all identities and backgrounds.
PGIM Operations and Innovation drives digital transformation, modern data analytics, and operational excellence across PGIM in partnership with our business and corporate functions. Our teams operate in a collaborative, agile manner and foster a strong community focused on the most relevant emerging technologies and best-in-class solutions.
Timeline:
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.
To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season. It is recommended that all applications be submitted in one sitting.
Your Day to Day:
Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:* Maintaining investment accounting, reporting and record keeping systems for various financial instruments
* Timely and accurate processing of trade activity, income payments, corporate actions, and deal restructurings in sub ledger systems
* Overseeing financial data quality in the data warehouse and reporting databases


You will be empowered to contribute in a meaningful way, add new value to organization initiatives and effect change. Your placement within the Investment Analyst position will be in one of the following areas:
Accounting
The accounting team is responsible for the validation of portfolio and transaction level activity including trades, income payments, derivative margins, acquisitions, distributions, corporate actions, and deal restructurings in sub-ledger systems.
Data Quality Group
This team manages the oversight of portfolio and security level financial data quality in the investment risk data warehouse, accounting system and reporting databases.
Reporting
The Reporting team supports partners by preparing, analyzing, and distributing limit monitoring, activity, income, and holdings reports on a daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis sourced from various internal data warehouses.
Financial Accounting and Client Reporting
Financial Accounting and Client Reporting supports the production of client Asset and Investment statements, regulatory reporting, client flow transaction processing, accounting, ledger entries, client record set-up, cash settlement, calculation and collection of fees, revenue reporting, AUM reporting, various reconciliations, and audit support.
Fund and Investor Services
Fund and Investor Services supports the calculation and validation of fund unit values, performance reporting, Transfer Agency - track ownership in commingled accounts; reconcile liabilities to clients’ total assets, new business/product development, fund and share class set-up, client flow transaction processing and forecasting, fund and client launch/transition coordination, bank/vendor liaison and oversight, regulatory reporting and financial statement support, trading - incl NSCC, various reconciliations and audit support.
Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2024 and May 2025
* Minimum 2.8 GPA required
* Proficiency in the MS Office Suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
* Ability to understand and analyze basic accounting principles and financial statements
* Knowledge of investment accounting and of various investment instruments
* Ability to work overtime during peak periods
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* Preferred majors include Accounting, Economics, Finance, Business, or related fields of study
* Strong Communication, interpersonal leadership, and organizational skills
* Client focused and result oriented work ethic
* Ability to work independently and work as a member of a team.


Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The salary range for this role is $60,000 to $70,000. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Prudential Private Capital: 2025 Trade Management Internship Program
description:
Job Classification:
Investment Management - Investment Operations
Prudential Private Capital: 2025 Trade Management Internship Program
Location(s):
Newark, NJ (Hybrid)
PGIM is the diversified asset management business of Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU). With $1.3 trillion in assets under management, and 41 offices spanning 20 countries, PGIM is among the world’s leading asset managers. Comprised of seven self-governing asset management divisions, PGIM offers a distinct workplace culture that aligns with the firm’s ultimate objective: to provide premier service to our clients while fostering an inclusive workplace culture that is rooted in trust, respect, and equality. PGIM was ranked #3 in Pensions & Investments Best Places to Work in Money Management in 2023. Prudential is a fully inclusive workplace: we value the unique perspectives and experiences of every individual, and we work hard ensure to Prudential is a welcoming and rewarding place to work for people of all identities and backgrounds.
Prudential Private Capital is the private capital investment arm of PGIM, the global investment management business Prudential Financial (of NYSE: PRU). Prudential Private Capital manages roughly $100 billion of private debt and equity investments in over 1,000 companies across the world. Click here to learn more about Prudential Private Capital.
Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.
To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season. It is recommended that all applications be submitted in one sitting.
Your Day to Day:
Responsibilities may include but are not limited to:* Providing trade support functions including settlement/disbursement, custody, deal capture and performance reporting
* Executing cash and trade settlements
* Support the loan origination business and various Enterprise and Asset management reports.


Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2026
* Minimum 3.0 GPA required.
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills
* Ability to understand and analyze basic accounting and finance principles


Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The hourly range for this role is $30.00-$35.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.
Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom.
Prudential is a multinational financial services leader with operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Leveraging its heritage of life insurance and asset management expertise, Prudential is focused on helping individual and institutional customers grow and protect their wealth. The company's well-known Rock symbol is an icon of strength, stability, expertise and innovation that has stood the test of time. Prudential's businesses offer a variety of products and services, including life insurance, annuities, retirement-related services, mutual funds, asset management, and real estate services.
We recognize that our strength and success are directly linked to the quality and skills of our diverse associates. We are proud to be a place where talented people who want to make a difference can grow as professionals, leaders, and as individuals. Visit www.prudential.com to learn more about our values, our history and our brand.
Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status , medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law.
The Prudential Insurance Company of America, Newark, NJ and its affiliates.

title: PGIM: 2025 Operations & Innovation, Innovation & Analytics Internship Program
description:
Job Classification:
Investment Management - Investment Operations
PGIM: 2025 Operations & Innovation, Innovation & Analytics Internship Program
Location(s): Newark, NJ
PGIM is the diversified asset management business of Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU). With $1.3 trillion in assets under management, and 41 offices spanning 20 countries, PGIM is among the world’s leading asset managers. Comprised of seven self-governing asset management divisions, PGIM offers a distinct workplace culture that aligns with the firm’s ultimate objective: to provide premier service to our clients while fostering an inclusive workplace culture that is rooted in trust, respect, and equality. PGIM was ranked #3 in Pensions & Investments Best Places to Work in Money Management in 2023. Prudential is a fully inclusive workplace: we value the unique perspectives and experiences of every individual, and we work hard to ensure Prudential is a welcoming and rewarding place to work for people of all identities and backgrounds.
PGIM Operations and Innovation drives digital transformation, modern data analytics, and operational excellence across PGIM in partnership with our business and corporate functions. Our teams operate in a collaborative, agile manner and foster a strong community focused on the most relevant emerging technologies and best-in-class solutions.
Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.
We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled.
To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season. It is recommended that all applications be submitted in one sitting.
Your Day to Day:
You will be empowered to contribute in a meaningful way, add new value to organization initiatives and effect change. Your placement within the Innovation & Analytics Internship Program will be in one of the following areas:
Data Analytics
The Data Analytics team analyzes the impacts of change, document, and support communication between relevant groups and stakeholders, and capture requirements needed to initiate a change. We develop, maintain, and manage reporting, analytics, dashboards in Tableau and PowerBI. We work with Data & Analytics workstream initiative teams and develop requirement documents and delivery roadmaps.
Digital Transformation
The Digital Transformation team is responsible for championing the best digital client experience possible. We partner with PGIM affiliates to understand their business needs, investigate new technologies, and partner with the appropriate technology teams to modernize our current digital footprint.
Market Data Services Analyst
Market Data Services is the centralized resource within Prudential responsible for procuring and coordinating all market data and research services globally. We cover all market data business management functions and are responsible for coordinating move, adds, or changes, submitting and reconciling invoices, updating the current inventory and databases, coordinating vendor meetings, and conducting research for market data vendors.
Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2026 and May 2027
* Minimum 2.8 GPA required
* Proficiency in the MS Office Suite: Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.
* Ability to understand and analyze basic accounting principles and financial statements.
* Knowledge of investment accounting and of various investment instruments
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration


Preferred Qualifications:* Preferred majors include Economics, Finance, Business, Information Technology, Information Systems, Business and Data Analytics, Computer Science, and/or related fields of study
* Strong Communication, interpersonal leadership, and organizational skills
* Client focused and result oriented work ethic
* Ability to work independently and work as a member of a team.
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills
* Ability to understand and analyze basic accounting principles and financial statements


Our Application Process:
Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.
For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.
Note: The salary range for this role is $26.00 to $30.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Production Manager - Active Apparel
description:
RBX Active, an up-and-coming Activewear brand, is looking for a Production Manager to support our Design and Merchandising department in product development and procurement. With a focus on Missy and Plus Activewear and Athleisure, you will have a chance to work on wide variety of styles and materials from various factories.

**Responsibilities**

* Partner with Design to ensure timely execution of product development calendar.
* Work with factory to prepare production schedules, cost estimates, issuing work orders and keeping progress records up-to-date
* Coordinate fit process with Design and Merchandising and ensure detailed notes are kept and communicated to the appropriate factory;
* Manage all e-mail communications with factory and suppliers to make sure that established standards and expected delivery dates are met.
* Partner with merchandising to confirm accuracy of size breaks, tickets and carton markings.
* Create, revise, input and maintain production orders and transmission to factories. Coordinate tracking of all pre-production samples and stock deliveries.
* Enter and maintain updates for each style in Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) system or shared drives; perform daily tracking of goods on order, in progress (WIP) and in-transit to ensure timely delivery according to development calendar; create and distribute production status reports; follow-up with vendors, factories and Design/Merchandising as needed.
* Negotiate pricing to ensure profitability, where appropriate. Track customs classification coordination with Imports department
* Identify and raise quality and technical issues with factories and mills.

**Qualifications**

* 4 years of experience in manufacturing. Minimum of 2 years in the apparel industry.
* Superior organizational skills and excellent communication skills; team oriented
* Able to work in fast paced environment and under pressure. Has a sense of urgency.
* Ability to multi-task and meet deadlines; highly detail oriented; Excellent follow up skills
* Bachelor’s Degree
* Proficient in Microsoft Office and Adobe products
* Knowledge of garment manufacturing, including construction, fabrication, trim and print techniques is a plus

We provide an industry-competitive salary, along with a comprehensive benefits plan (medical, dental, vision) that includes, Summer Fridays, generous PTO, merchandise discounts, career development opportunities, and a pleasant work environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Employee discount
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Production management: 4 years (Required)

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10018

title: Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Internal Audit Data Analytics Internship Program
description:
Job Classification:
Technology - Engineering & Cloud
Prudential: 2025 Corporate, Internal Audit Data Analytics Internship Program  

Location(s):
 Newark, NJ, Shelton, CT, Plymouth, MN; (Hybrid)  

Prudential Financial, Inc. (NYSE: PRU), a global financial services leader and premier active global investment manager with approximately $1.5 trillion in assets under management as of March 31, 2024, has operations in the United States, Asia, Europe, and Latin America. Prudential’s diverse and talented employees help make lives better and create financial opportunity for more people by expanding access to investing, insurance, and retirement security. Prudential’s iconic Rock symbol has stood for strength, stability, expertise, and innovation for nearly 150 years. For more information, please visit news.prudential.com.  

Are you a freshman, sophomore, or junior looking to put your data analytics skills to use in a business setting? Are you organized, analytical in nature, and looking to thrive in a collaborative/dynamic work environment? Do you want to work with experienced professionals and subject matter experts to help you develop your technical skillset? If this sounds like you, that’s a challenge we can help you meet as a member of our Data Analytics Internship Program.  

Data is widely recognized as a critical enterprise resource in today’s business technology environment. We are looking for top-performing students who excel at analytical problem solving. As a Data Analytics Intern, you will improve business initiatives through operational enhancement while aligning our technical capabilities towards efficient and strategic business solutions. Your work will help us move beyond the numbers—and on to the narrative of what is happening, why it is happening and where things are likely to go in the future.  

Timeline:
The internship program will run from Monday, June 2nd, 2025, to Friday, August 8th, 2025.  

We review applications on a rolling basis, and we encourage you to apply as soon as you are ready. All fall applications will close on or by Friday, October 4th, 2024, at midnight ET. We reserve the right to close applications early due to volume or role(s) being filled. *Applications for PGIM Investment Professional roles are open as of July 1st. All other businesses will open on August 2nd**.* To ensure you are considered for the opportunities you want most, you are only able to apply to 3 positions per recruitment season.  

Your Day-to-Day:  

The 10-week Internal Audit Data Analytics Internship Program will provide you with valuable professional and personal development experiences. Some projects you could find yourself working on include:* Gaining exposure to external research, business systems and data tools that will help you further develop your career and analytical abilities including Microsoft Office Suite, SQL, Python, Tableau, or PowerBI
* Identifying hypothesis-driven scenarios to monitor risk and test control effectiveness to support internal audit engagements
* Mining vast data stores to discover business insights and operational improvement opportunities
  

Beyond your day-to-day work, you’ll have the opportunity to provide new perspectives and are excited about Prudential’s culture of giving back to the communities where we live and work. Come join us for an insightful and personalized summer internship experience. As part of our hiring process, we will help match you with the team or business group that is the best fit for your skills and your unique professional goals.  

  

Required Qualifications:* Candidates must be enrolled in an accredited bachelor’s program graduating between December 2025 and May 2027
* Preferred majors include Management Information Systems, Business Administration, Business and Information Systems, Statistics, Business Analytics, or any other applicable area of study.
* Minimum 3.0 GPA recommended
* Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration
  

Preferred Qualifications:* Experience with one or more tools such as Tableau, Power BI, R, Python, AWS, Text Mining Tools, SQL Server
* Strong PC skills (MS Office suite including MS Project, Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Visio, SharePoint, OneDrive, and Outlook)
  

Our Application Process:  

Submit your application. If eligible, receive invitation for a digital interview; this includes answering pre-recorded interview questions with the business(es) that advance your application(s). If advanced, receive invitation for final round interview(s); you will have the opportunity to meet with us in person or virtually to learn more about our business and culture.  

For 2025 early talent roles, our process is designed to help you learn more about Prudential/PGIM and share your story with us. Digital interviewing allows greater flexibility, enables a quicker interview process, allows us to meet more candidates and share your story with more members of the team.  

Note: The pay range for this role is $36.00 to $38.00. Specific pricing for the role may vary within the above range based on many factors including geographic location, candidate experience, and skills. Roles may also be eligible for additional compensation and/or benefits. Eligibility to participate in a discretionary annual incentive program is subject to the rules governing the program, whereby an award, if any, depends on various factors including, without limitation, individual and organizational performance.

title: Banquet Server
description:
## Job Summary  
We are seeking a dedicated Banquet Server to join our team. The ideal candidate will assist in providing exceptional guest service during events and banquets, ensuring a memorable dining experience for all attendees.

## Responsibilities  
- Set up banquet rooms as per event orders  
- Serve food and beverages to guests in a professional and courteous manner  
- Clear tables efficiently and reset for the next course  
- Assist in bussing tables and maintaining a clean dining area  
- Prepare and serve coffee or other beverages as requested  
- Interact with guests to ensure satisfaction and handle any inquiries promptly  
- Collaborate with the culinary team to deliver high-quality service

## Requirements  
- Prior experience in food service, banquets, or restaurants is preferred  
- Strong customer service skills with a focus on guest relations  
- Ability to handle food safely and follow proper food handling procedures  
- Excellent communication skills and a friendly demeanor  
- Willingness to work in a fast-paced environment and stand for extended periods

Join our team as a Banquet Server and be part of creating memorable experiences for our guests!

Job Type: Seasonal

Pay: $16.00 per hour

Physical Setting:

* Bar

Shift:

* Evening shift

Ability to Commute:

* Central Valley, NY 10917 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Team Member
description:
**Job description**

**Team Member**

**part time or full time**

**Brand summary**

New Jersey Steakburgers is a franchisee of Freddy's Frozen Custard & Steakburgers. We're looking for the best and brightest to deliver a unique mix of fun, fresh food and genuine hospitality! Founded in 2002, Freddy’s Frozen Custard & Steakburgers has quickly become a national, fast-casual restaurant franchise best known for its cooked-to-order Steakburgers, crispy shoestring fries, dessert treats prepared with freshly churned frozen custard, and world-class guest service. Enjoying great food does not mean your meal has to be cooked before you order. At Freddy’s Frozen Custard & Steakburgers, your meal is prepared fresh, after to you order it. The genuine hospitality, family-friendly atmosphere and classic menu favorites seamlessly combine to create a timeless dining experience guests of all ages enjoy.

**Job description:**

Freddy’s Frozen Custard & Steakburgers - Cold Line Team Member - Cashier & Frozen Custard Prep

**Responsibilities:**

* Take guests' orders at the cash register or through the drive through headset
* Prepare our fabulous frozen custard treats for the guests
* Operate the cash register
* Work the drive thru window ensuring the guests get their food with a smile
* Maintain a clean dining room

**Requirements:**

* Ability to serve guests with a smile and genuine hospitality!
* Dependability and attention to detail

* Great meal discount of 70% on our delicious food
* Amazing culture centered on the team and family-friendly hours
* Flexible schedules for outside activities and school
* Opportunities to advance and grow - we promote from within
* **Paid sick time**

* Comprehensive health benefits including medical, dental, and vision insurance
* Life and disability insurance
* Paid vacation time

title: Dental Assistant (with X-Ray License)
description:
Come join one of the "Top 10 Emerging Groups to Watch", as voted by Group Dentistry Now! We are a busy family practice performing all phases of general dentistry as well as perio and ortho, and we are looking for FT/PT Dental Assistants to join our team. X-Ray License Required. Apply today!
  
  

**Benefits for Full Time Employment:**  

Health Insurance, Bonus Pay, Paid Time Off, Paid Holidays, 401(K) and more!
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Welcome customers in the dental office
* Prepare customers for treatments or checkups ensuring their comfort
* Select and set up instruments, equipment and material needed
* Sterilize instruments according to regulations
* Assist the dentist through 4-handed dentistry
* Undertake lab tasks as instructed
* Provide oral hygiene and post-operative care instructions
* Keep the dental room clean and well-stocked
* Schedule appointments
* Maintain accurate patient records and assist with payment procedures


Skills
  
  

* X-Ray License required
* Knowledge of dental instruments and sterilization methods
* Understanding of health & safety regulations
* Ability to perform regulated non-surgical tasks like coronal polishing is a plus
* Good computer skills
* Excellent communication and people skills
* Attention to detail
* Well-organized and reliable
* High school diploma; graduating from dental assistant school is preferred
* Bilingual in Spanish and English preferred
* Salary is commensurate with experience; Range $20-25
* This position is for our Newark, NJ office or Clifton, NJ office.
* For our Newark office, Bilingual in Spanish and English is required.

title: Dental Office Manager
description:
Come join one of the "Top 10 Emerging Groups to Watch", as voted by Group Dentistry Now! We are looking for an Office manager to organize and coordinate administration duties and office procedures. Your role is to create and maintain a pleasant work environment, ensuring high levels of organizational effectiveness, communication and safety. Ultimately, the Office manager should be able to ensure the smooth running of the office and help to improve company procedures and day-to-day operation.
  
  

**Benefits for Full Time Employment:**  

Health Insurance, Bonus Pay, PTO, Paid Holidays, 401(K) and more!
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

* Serve as the point person for office manager duties including: maintenance, mailing, supplies, equipment, bills, errands
* Schedule meetings and appointments
* Organize the office layout and order stationery and equipment
* Maintain the office condition and arrange necessary repairs
* Liaison with the HR department
* Maintain office operations and procedures
* Coordinate with IT department on all office equipment
* Ensure that all items are invoiced and paid on time
* Manage office General and Administrative budget, ensure accurate and timely reporting
* Provide general support to visitors
* Assist in the onboarding process for new hires
* Address employees' queries regarding office management issues (e.g. stationery, Hardware and travel arrangements)
* Liaise with facility management vendors, including cleaning, catering and security services


Skills
  
  

* Minimum 2 Years Proven experience as an Office manager, Front Office Manager or Administrative Assistant
* Dental Office Management experience preferred
* Knowledge of office administrator responsibilities, systems and procedures
* Proficiency in MS Office (MS Excel and MS Outlook, in particular)
* Hands on experience with office machines (e.g. fax machines and printers)
* Familiarity with email scheduling tools, like Email Scheduler and Boomerang
* Excellent time management skills and ability to multi-task and prioritize work
* Attention to detail and problem-solving skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Strong organizational and planning skills in a fast-paced environment
* A creative mind with an ability to suggest improvements
* High School degree
* Bilingual in Spanish and English preferred
* Salary is commensurate with experience; Range $25-30
* This position is for our East Orange, NJ office.
